item.title: How I Use Tmux
item.description: For MacOS, I chose iTerm2 because itâ€™s able to send a series of hex codes to the terminal via a keybind. Again, if I am using tmux through ssh, I can still use the keybindings, as if tmux were running locally. Setting up the keybinds is not the most straightforward process. In the iTerm2 Settings > Profiles > Keys, I added new keybindings with the “+” button. And in the dialog dropdown, I chose “Send Hex Code.
